laboratory_examinations.findings: Characteristic elastic fiber changes featuring a considerable accumulation of clumped fibers in the mid dermis that stained black with von Kossa stain. Epidermis, papillary dermis, and subcutaneous fat were unremarkable.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Progressively developed small peripapillary angioid streaks and similar skin changes in the axillary, inguinal, popliteal, and antecubital folds.

laboratory_examinations.procedure_name: Histopathological examination of lesional skin biopsy
laboratory_examinations.findings: Swollen and irregularly clumped elastic fibers in the mid dermis and calcium deposits within the fibers revealed by von Kossa staining.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Developed yellowish papules on the side of the neck a few months after transplantation.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Characteristic dermal elastic tissue changes of PXE on Verhoeff-van-Gieson stain; von Kossa stain showed calcification of the dystrophic elastic fibers.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Clinical signs of progression were stable since 2006.

laboratory_examinations.findings: No known deleterious ABCC6 mutations were detected.
Completely normal findings with no evidence of peau d’orange or angioid streaks.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: No changes noted since the patient’s previous examinations.
